lead_paragraph: COLEMAN--John A.,84, of White Plains, NY, died March 11, 2016. He was born May 11, 1931 in NYC to Alvin E. and Kathryn (Falk) Coleman. John graduated from Yale University in 1953 and served in the U.S. Air Force from 1953-1955. After the Air Force, John worked at the family business Coleman & Company from 1954-1968, and later as an executive search consultant at Haskell & Stern. He served as President of the New York City Mission Society, Temple Emanuel of Westchester and the Century Country Club. On February 26, 1961, John married Ann E. Coleman in Englewood, NJ. Besides his wife Ann, John is survived by his three children John A. (Jay) Coleman, Jr. of Stamford, CT, Richard E. Coleman of Stamford, CT and Alice M. Coleman of Chappaqua, NY. Also surviving is his sister Doris Kempner, six grandchildren, Maisy C. Holehouse, John B. Coleman, Cecelia L. Coleman, Annabelle C. Holehouse, Mason S. Coleman and Harper Coleman. In lieu of flowers please send donations to New York City Mission Society. A viewing will be held Saturday 5-7pm and a service Sunday 1pm at McMahon, Lyon & Hartnett Funeral Home, Inc. (914) 949-7777. Burial to follow Kensico Cemetery Valhalla, NY. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  COLEMAN, JOHN A.
